fields.description: To bundle images one needs to obtain a copy of cloud-cert.pem.  To configure region federation one needs to obtain a certificate fingerprint.  A means of obtaining the certificates via web services for purposes such as these should be chosen and explicitly supported so clients like euca2ools can use them.
fields.summary: Document and support a means of obtaining the certificates needed for bundling images and setting up region federation

comments.body: EUCA-10442 has some preliminary information on how you can determine the X.509 certificate fingerprints. There will be further changes in this area for HTTPS configuration.

A new DescribeServiceCertificates action is added to empyrean for discovery of the "image-bundling" certificate. Parameters for the action are:

* Format - pem|der to control the format of the certificate in the response
* FingerprintDigest - to specify the fingerprint digest algorithm (e.g. SHA-1, SHA-256)

filters can also be used as follows:

* service-type - the type of the services to return certificates for, e.g. compute
* certificate-usage - the certificate usages to return, e.g. image-bundling

The action can be used by authenticated users (when permitted by any applicable IAM policy)
Do people need {{empyrean:DescribeServiceCertificates}} statements in their policies to use this, then?
Regular users in an account would need permission for the action but the "admin" would not, the prefix used for policy is "euserv" not "empyrean".

Fix verified.

This test isn't doing anything with region federation, but I have come to the conclusion that the title of this issue is mentioning region federation because the cloud certificate obtained by this DescribeServiceCertificates service is capable of being used for both bundling tasks as well as region federation tasks.

Therefore the test output for bundling is below.  I unset EUCALYPTUS_CERT so that I didn't have a local cert listed.  You will see by the debug output that this uses the certificate provided by bootstrap service.

{code:java}

[root@d-23 admin]# more eucarc 
EUCA_KEY_DIR=$(cd $(dirname ${BASH_SOURCE:-$0}); pwd -P)
export EC2_URL=http://compute.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export S3_URL=http://objectstorage.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_IAM_URL=http://euare.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export EUARE_URL=http://euare.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export TOKEN_URL=http://tokens.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_AUTO_SCALING_URL=http://autoscaling.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL=http://cloudformation.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL=http://cloudwatch.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_ELB_URL=http://loadbalancing.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_SIMPLEWORKFLOW_URL=http://simpleworkflow.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export EUSTORE_URL=http://emis.eucalyptus.com/
export EC2_PRIVATE_KEY=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-5c2f5a68-pk.pem
export EC2_CERT=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-5c2f5a68-cert.pem
export EC2_JVM_ARGS=-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/jssecacerts
export EUCALYPTUS_CERT=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/cloud-cert.pem
export EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER='499793183824'
export EC2_ACCESS_KEY='AKIAALPYYUBVTWML6JY7'
export EC2_SECRET_KEY='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'
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY='AKIAALPYYUBVTWML6JY7'
export AWS_SECRET_KEY='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'
export AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/iamrc
export EC2_USER_ID='499793183824'
alias ec2-bundle-image="ec2-bundle-image --cert ${EC2_CERT} --privatekey ${EC2_PRIVATE_KEY} --user ${EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER}
 --ec2cert ${EUCALYPTUS_CERT}"
alias ec2-upload-bundle="ec2-upload-bundle -a ${EC2_ACCESS_KEY} -s ${EC2_SECRET_KEY} --url ${S3_URL}"
[root@d-23 admin]# . eucarc
[root@d-23 admin]# unset EUCALYPTUS_CERT
[root@d-23 admin]# echo $EUCALYPTUS_CERT

[root@d-23 admin]# euca-install-image -n centos66try2 -i ../../CentOS-6-x86_64-GenericCloud.raw -r x86_64 --virtualization-type hvm -b centostry2 --bootstrap-url $EUCA_BOOTSTRAP_URL --debug

worklogs.comment:
Fix verified.

This test isn't doing anything with region federation, but I have come to the conclusion that the title of this issue is mentioning region federation because the cloud certificate obtained by this DescribeServiceCertificates service is capable of being used for both bundling tasks as well as region federation tasks.

Therefore the test output for bundling is below.  I unset EUCALYPTUS_CERT so that I didn't have a local cert listed.  You will see by the debug output that this uses the certificate provided by bootstrap service.

{code:java}

[root@d-23 admin]# more eucarc 
EUCA_KEY_DIR=$(cd $(dirname ${BASH_SOURCE:-$0}); pwd -P)
export EC2_URL=http://compute.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export S3_URL=http://objectstorage.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_IAM_URL=http://euare.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export EUARE_URL=http://euare.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export TOKEN_URL=http://tokens.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_AUTO_SCALING_URL=http://autoscaling.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL=http://cloudformation.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL=http://cloudwatch.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_ELB_URL=http://loadbalancing.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export AWS_SIMPLEWORKFLOW_URL=http://simpleworkflow.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
export EUSTORE_URL=http://emis.eucalyptus.com/
export EC2_PRIVATE_KEY=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-5c2f5a68-pk.pem
export EC2_CERT=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-5c2f5a68-cert.pem
export EC2_JVM_ARGS=-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/jssecacerts
export EUCALYPTUS_CERT=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/cloud-cert.pem
export EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER='499793183824'
export EC2_ACCESS_KEY='AKIAALPYYUBVTWML6JY7'
export EC2_SECRET_KEY='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'
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY='AKIAALPYYUBVTWML6JY7'
export AWS_SECRET_KEY='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'
export AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/iamrc
export EC2_USER_ID='499793183824'
alias ec2-bundle-image="ec2-bundle-image --cert ${EC2_CERT} --privatekey ${EC2_PRIVATE_KEY} --user ${EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER}
 --ec2cert ${EUCALYPTUS_CERT}"
alias ec2-upload-bundle="ec2-upload-bundle -a ${EC2_ACCESS_KEY} -s ${EC2_SECRET_KEY} --url ${S3_URL}"
[root@d-23 admin]# . eucarc
[root@d-23 admin]# unset EUCALYPTUS_CERT
